author: Saumya Vaishampayan
title: The Weakest Link: Hong Kong Dollar Hits Trading-Band Floor
text:
One of the longest-running relationships in global currency markets is under threat.
The Hong Kong dollar hit the weakest level against its U.S. counterpart that is permitted under the rules of a peg between the two currencies first implemented in 1983. The U.S. dollar traded as high as 7.85 Hong Kong dollars shortly before 5 a.m. in Hong Kong and continued to trade near that level through Hong Kongâ€™s evening, according to Thomson Reuters data.
